Carinna Ferguson is a [Learning Sciences and Human Development](https://counselingandlearningsci.wvu.edu/academics/lshd-phd) Doctoral Student in the Department of Counseling and Learning Sciences within the College of Education and Human Services at West Virginia University. She earned a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology at West Virginia University. Her research interests include high-impact programs, program evaluation, and impacts of undergraduate research experiences across disciplines. Her current research examines the experiences of art and humanities students engaging in undergraduate research. She currently works as a Graduate Teaching Assistant for the Research Apprenticeship Program at WVU. In her spare time, she enjoys cooking, listening to podcasts, and spending time with her two cats.
